title: 110_hr1376
content: The Act titled "Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007" establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. The Act establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage, with specific amendments to the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to include independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. Amendments include changes to sections 1905(w) and 1902, specifying subclauses (XVII) and (XVIII) in the text. The Social Security Act is amended to include independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. Amendments involve changing subsections in sections 1903(f)(4) and 1905 of the Act. The Social Security Act is amended to include independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. Amendments involve changing subsections in sections 1903(f)(4) and 1905 of the Act, including updating specific references throughout the text. The Social Security Act is amended to include independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. Specific references throughout the text are updated, including changing subsections in sections 1903(f)(4) and 1905 of the Act. Amendments are made to sections 1916A(b)(3) and 1937(a)(2)(B)(x) by replacing "1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII)" with "1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVII)" each place it appears. Effective date for these amendments is set for calendar quarters beginning on or after October 1, 2007. The Social Security Act is amended to include independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage, with amendments effective for calendar quarters starting on or after October 1, 2007. State plans for medical assistance under title XIX of the Act may require State legislation to meet additional requirements imposed by the amendments. The Social Security Act is amended to include independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. States may need to meet additional requirements imposed by the amendments before the first day of the first calendar quarter beginning after the close of the first regular session of the State legislature.
